newsitem.title: USA: Health Management credit line reinstated.
newsitem.headline: Health Management credit line reinstated.

text.p: Health Management Inc said on Friday that lenders reinstated $1 million of its total senior credit facility, which had been frozen.

The company also said it is aggressively pursuing strategic alternatives, including interim and long-term financing, a possible sale or merger of the company or a possible Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing.
Health Management said its lenders originally entered into a forbearance agreement in July 1996 and that agreement continues to have an agreement relating to the $1 million loan.

In addition, under terms of the agreement relating to the new $1 million loan, the lenders had requested that the company grant them a warrant to buy five percent of the common stock of the company. Terms and conditions are still being negotiated.

William Nicol, Health Management president, said in a statement: "The company continues to operate under significant cash flow constraints. The recent bankruptcy filing by the company's primary product wholesaler, Foxmeyer, has put significant additional strain on our cash flow."
Nicol added that the company was "aggressively pursuing our strategic and financial alternatives...any of which could be highly dilutive to existing shareholders."
Health Management provides integrated pharmacy management services to patients with chronic medical conditions and to health care professionals and drug manufacturers.
